conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for checking in again, and I appreciate how clear and consistent you’ve been about School_C being your first choice.

At this moment, our position has not changed: we are still holding our single remaining seat for the possibility of an application from higher-priority candidates ahead of you—most importantly Student_B (and, to a lesser extent, Student_A and Student_D).

To answer your questions as directly as I can:
- We do not have confirmed information that Student_B / Student_A / Student_D have all matched elsewhere or have definitively stopped pursuing School_C.
- The key “signal” that would cause us to release the seat and move to the next candidate in our priority order would be either (a) clear confirmation that those higher-priority candidates have matched elsewhere, or (b) the process advancing further with no contact/application from them such that it becomes unreasonable to expect they will apply.

Practically, if we reach the next few rounds and we still have not received an application from Student_B (and we have no indication they are still in play for us), we will reassess promptly. If/when that reassessment moves you to the top of the remaining available candidates, we would reach back out immediately.

I understand this uncertainty is difficult. To protect your outcome, I still encourage you to keep active conversations with other schools while we continue to monitor whether any higher-priority candidates approach us.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

Given students’ preferences: B ranks School_C 2nd (after E), C ranks us 2nd, while A and D rank us last. So the main realistic higher-priority threat is Student_B (and possibly Student_A/Student_D only if rejected everywhere). Without confirmation they are matched, accepting E now could block a higher-priority match. Student_E sent [TALK], so we should respond with [TALK], explain that we cannot commit yet, and specify a reasonable “signal”/timeline (e.g., if we receive confirmation B is matched elsewhere or after a certain round with no contact from higher-priority candidates) while encouraging E to keep options open.
